required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Antrum Surface Between Women With Operative Hysteroscopy or Planned Caesarean Section
clinical_study.official_title: Gastric Ultrasound Before Planned Caesarean Section or Operative Hysteroscopy : How Much Pregnancy Changes Surface of Antrum of the Stomach ? Comparative Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: Realization of a gastric ultrasound just before surgery, to measure the surface of antrum of stomach and compare if divergence sizes can be observed between women with a operative hysteroscopy and women with a planned caesarean section. To know if anaesthesia need to be adapted to the population.

primary_outcome.description: Measure of gastric antrum surface by Ultrasound on operative hysteroscopy women and planned caesarean section women.

secondary_outcome.description: Perlas score (Grade 0, defined as an empty antrum in both the supine and the right lateral decubitus positions, indicates that the stomach is completely empty; grade 1, defined as visualisation of gastric fluid content in the right lateral position only, corresponds to low gastric fluid volume; grade 2, defined by visualisation of liquid contents in both supine and right lateral positions, suggests a high gastric fluid volume with increased risk for pulmonary aspiration) measure by Ultrasound on operative hysteroscopy women and planned caesarean section women.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of anxiety on gastric residue with a numeric scale
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of anxiety with a numeric scale (0 = no anxiety, 10 = maximal anxiety)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of frequency of intraoperative inhalation
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of proportion of inhalation between the two population

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of fasting on gastric residue between the two populations
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of antral surface with fasting as covariable

arm_group.description: women with an operative hysteroscopy planned
Pregnant women with a planned caesarean section

study_pop.textblock: Women comming to hospital/sites for a planned caesarean section or operative hysteroscopy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 18 and 40
- Membership of a national insurance scheme
- Written consent
- Physical status score or American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) score = 1 or 2
- Planned caesarean section or operative hysteroscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not able to give her written consent (not speaking French), under legal protection
- Insulin-dependant diabetes
- Hiatus hernia
- History of gastro-oesophageal surgery
- Contraindication to right lateral decubitus
- Treatments with anti-acids before ultrasounds.
